{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3566258,"name":"James","username":"JamerGamer789","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-23T21:51:23.027Z","cooked":"

Hey everyone, this is going to be a long thread about optimizing autonomous motions for scoring as much coral as possible when loading from the station. We have a few questions, but hopefully this can serve as a thread for teams looking to make the most of autos for DCMP and Champs.

Our team has made several improvements to our autonomous from our week 1 event to week 4. Mainly increasing our elevator speeds. We had a 2 coral auto in week 1, now we have a 2.5 in week 4.

(We are 3546 btw)
Week 1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F_mG1IgphFM&t=1s
Week 4: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B9J4XkBDC5E&t=1s

We want to hit 3 coral for DCMP, but we had a few challenges to overcome.

  1. When we increased the speed of the drivetrain, the elevator would sway slightly and the drivetrain would not align close enough to the target pose.
  2. Even with our slow speeds, if autonomous ended and the elevator was up, the robot would come very close to tipping over.

I’m curious to hear what others are doing for auto to keep their robot from tipping, and driving to paths accurately. I see a lot of teams driving quickly to the Reef, then raising their elevator and moving slowly. Is this something we should try to adopt? Our elevator is not the fastest, so I don’t know if this is the path we want to adopt (I may be wrong with comparing the speeds to other teams, so let me know if our elevator does look plenty quick to do this).

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-03-23T21:53:44.519Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":196,"readers_count":195,"score":69.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496634,"topic_slug":"optimizing-autonomous-scoring","display_username":"James","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B9J4XkBDC5E&t=1s","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":8},{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F_mG1IgphFM&t=1s","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51278,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/optimizing-autonomous-scoring/496634/1","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3566288,"name":"Jeffrey Davis","username":"Practicality","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/practicality/{size}/208492_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-23T22:21:33.255Z","cooked":"

Is there anything you can do weight-wise to have more weight lower on your robot? That will make it less tippy.

But yes, your general idea is correct, raising the elevator after lining up so that you are only going in a straight line will keep it from skewing your alignment. I.e. quickly do any maneuvering with the elevator down and then do a simultaneous elevator lift while driving straight toward the scoring position.

I also highly recommend adding vision for the final alignment to correct any errors that occur while lining up.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-03-23T22:21:33.255Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":165,"readers_count":164,"score":53.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":496634,"topic_slug":"optimizing-autonomous-scoring","display_username":"Jeffrey Davis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62548,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/optimizing-autonomous-scoring/496634/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3566323,"name":"James","username":"JamerGamer789","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-23T22:49:37.647Z","cooked":"

We can put 7 more pounds into our bumper weight, other than that there is not much more we can do. We are using vision to update our odometry for path planner. I’ve thought about it more, and these are the steps I’ve come up with after scoring the initial coral

  1. Drive to the coral station quickly and intake a coral
  2. Drive quickly to about halfway the distance between the coral station and reef
  3. Add a slow zone where the last half is slow, and the elevator raises to the l4 height to score

What do you think?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-03-23T22:49:37.647Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":136,"readers_count":135,"score":32.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496634,"topic_slug":"optimizing-autonomous-scoring","display_username":"James","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":62548,"username":"Practicality","name":"Jeffrey Davis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/practicality/{size}/208492_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51278,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/optimizing-autonomous-scoring/496634/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3566328,"name":"MrBasse","username":"MrBasse","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrbasse/{size}/65032_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-23T22:57:01.548Z","cooked":"

We spent a lot of time tuning for getting our 2 coral bumped to 3. There are a few times in your path where you could shave some time, but you have to have faith that the robot will do what it is supposed to do and that your HP can feed a little before they think they need to.

We can show you guys some of the spots we trimmed time and maybe we can run a few to see what it looks like if you guys come over this week to use our cage set up. We have a quarter field for practice so it works well for a one sided auto to test.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-03-23T22:57:01.548Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":109,"readers_count":108,"score":41.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":496634,"topic_slug":"optimizing-autonomous-scoring","display_username":"MrBasse","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51278,"username":"JamerGamer789","name":"James","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e19b73/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16614,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC #3572"},"post_url":"/t/optimizing-autonomous-scoring/496634/4","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3566366,"name":"James","username":"JamerGamer789","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-23T23:27:37.198Z","cooked":"

That would be awesome, definitely looking forward to testing our climb and checking out the build space

I watched a few matches with your autonomous, and it seems like a pretty good representation of what I am trying to achieve. We might have to make some tweaks because of our heavy scoring mechanism, either with path speed or adding weight to the bumpers.
